snippet.textDisplay: Mad to scapegoat one player when we lost 3-0 and had one shot on target. The performances have been below par for a few weeks now, not sure what the problem is, I think maybe teams have found a way to play against us, Klopp will sort it out and it will be fine. The disappointment is that we could have achieved so much more and we kind of threw it away without much of a fight. If we’d have lost it to City it would have been more painful but equally more understandable. If we’d have gone down to Watford having lost 1-0 and just had some bad luck and deserved to win that would have been understandable too. It’s just gutting that we lost our heads, didn’t really threaten and were deserved losers against a poor side. On the bright side, we now have zero distractions going for the FA cup or Champions League if we can get past a Chelsea and turn it around against Atletico. We essentially need to win 4 games in the league and now we aren’t going for invincible we can take our foot of the gas a little bit and rest players for the cup competitions. If we can win either the CL/PL double, FA cup/PL double or the treble no one is going to remember losing to Watford in the league. The focus will have shifted.
snippet.textOriginal: Mad to scapegoat one player when we lost 3-0 and had one shot on target. If we’d have lost it to City it would have been more painful but equally more understandable. If we’d have gone down to Watford having lost 1-0 and just had some bad luck and deserved to win that would have been understandable too. It’s just gutting that we lost our heads, didn’t really threaten and were deserved losers against a poor side. On the bright side, we now have zero distractions going for the FA cup or Champions League if we can get past a Chelsea and turn it around against Atletico. We essentially need to win 4 games in the league and now we aren’t going for invincible we can take our foot of the gas a little bit and rest players for the cup competitions. If we can win either the CL/PL double, FA cup/PL double or the treble no one is going to remember losing to Watford in the league. The focus will have shifted.

snippet.textDisplay:
Cue the Liverpool fan scapegoating.
TAA makes a crucial pass for the opposite team, VVD sleeps in on the job but nah, we gonna blame Lovren for all of it.

Your team was shit, even if the defense didn't make mistakes, your attack went nowhere. You went ninety minutes and had one shot on goal against a relegation team.
But it's okay, next time you catch your girlfriend sleeping with your best mate you can blame Lovren for that too.

If you're gonna talk shit about the man at least say his name right, he's not a fucking type of mustard.

snippet.textDisplay: Simple thing was we didnt show up. Lovren should of been sold a long time ago and a replacement brought in. Lovren was total garbage but the rest of the team wasnt much better. We got away with it with west ham, the cracks were showing in that game. But we shouldn't be to bothered the league is ours and it shows Klopp now that Lovren should be done at lfc. This should give the squad the kick up the backside they needed. Dont forget this is just one loss all season. I dont mind if we lose but at least give a good account of yourself when losing which we didnt! I'm shocked klopp actually put lovren ahead of matip

snippet.textDisplay: Needed Matip, overall the best partner for Van Dijk to me, was critical in defense in our run last year for the league and the champions league. Matip is just as underrated as Henderson, but Matip defends well, tall, got a bit of pace, and most importantly loves the occasional dribble forward and looks for gaps to make a forward pass. Thats what Liverpool needed yesterday. Also the front 3 are losing their blade, they just want to be in the box to score goals, they need to learn to shoot from outside the box or from distance like Haaland against PSG or like Lallana did yesterday when he hit the post. It was just a bad day at the office, bc lacked commitment and desire to win. Ignore the haters who come out just bc Liverpool lost their first game and arent going unbeaten, we are still gonna win the league and Anfield is gonna turn over Atletico. Keep going boys, Y.W.N.A.
snippet.textOriginal: Needed Matip, overall the best partner for Van Dijk to me, was critical in defense in our run last year for the league and the champions league. Matip is just as underrated as Henderson, but Matip defends well, tall, got a bit of pace, and most importantly loves the occasional dribble forward and looks for gaps to make a forward pass. Thats what Liverpool needed yesterday. Also the front 3 are losing their blade, they just want to be in the box to score goals, they need to learn to shoot from outside the box or from distance like Haaland against PSG or like Lallana did yesterday when he hit the post. It was just a bad day at the office, bc lacked commitment and desire to win. snippet.textDisplay: I was disappointed like all of us I am clams down from yesterday and I look at the bright side of thing, it was such a long time that we lost a league game that why when it happen it feel worst then it should, if we have lost this game earlier in the season it would have not feel this bad, it just that we were so close to achieving something extraordinarily but come up shorty with one of the worst performances in years, I guess it happen, it happen 3 years in a row, we were close to winging the CL we didn’t, we so close to wining epl we didn’t, we so close of going invincible but we didn’t . But look what happen we improve we learn as a team grows as a team, we come back to win the CL the year after, we come back to win EPL this year after so close last year, am sure it will be better than what we have this year next season, cos all I see is we always goes one better that what we got the season before...the player achieve so much in such a short period of time, they deserve to have a shit day at the office every now and then.. they bring us so much joy they will continue to do the same, we will support them no matter what YNWA

As a Liverpool fan, its defence is the biggest concern at this moment.
I don't understand the job role of 3: Alex Arnold, Van dike and Lovren
The kid AA must understand and be mature before he plays football....dont go for statistic (how may pass/ assist) the matter count is experience and skills which this baby kid does not have. he's a waste of lfc RB. he must stick into his job role as RB before he tries to do any smart job. if JK dont feel it yet, hes doing a big mistake!

You spent too much time on Lovren piling shit on him. Couldn’t see that with a long winning run, being number one by far, unprecedented, at some point, something will have to give. So here we are.

Liverpool needed this, as strange and unpopular as this may sound, it’s a shifting gears, if you will, and for Kloop to assess the strategy for the rest of the season.

This is not as bad as some might think.

snippet.textDisplay:
Allison - Fine
Robbo - I dont know what happened to him, but everytime he got the ball he slowed it down and was always looking to pass the ball back into the middle. Really gave me flashes of Rafa style football.
VVD - Fine. Was kind of shaky but not too bad.
Lovren - Lovren
Trent - Looked tired and unfocused.
Fabinho - The only one I thought actually had a good game.
Wijnaldum - Has looked uninterested for a while now, maybe the contract thing is throwing him but he needs some time on the sidelines.
Ox - Tried his best but still needs a good run of games to get back in the zone like he was towards the end of 2017/18.
Mane - Is always trying his best but it just isnt coming off for him at the moment.
Firmino - Bring in Werner.
Salah - Bring in Sancho.


Salah and Firmino have it too easy, the fact that they have been playing so poor for so long and still dont need to worry about their place is symptomatic of our form recently. Personally i feel that we havent done enough to freshen up. Werid saying that considering we have only lost 1 game, but seriously when is the last game we can look to for a Proper good performance? Sheffield Utd would be the one I go for. That was 2 months ago. Leicester 4-0 and then Everton 5-2 and City 3-1. They would be the only games I can look to and say "Yeah we played really well". Like how many times have we had to hear commentators this season saying "Liverpool not really hitting their stride" or "Not a vintage Liverpool performance" or something along the lines of that? Because for me it seems to be every other week.
But back to the point about freshness. Firmino's last goal at anfield was 10 and a half months ago. I know he is not an out and out goalscorer and brings alot to the team, but has he been recently? I say he hasnt. When teams sit back, which they have to now, he has to drop so deep its like having 4 in the midfield. Now put Aguero in that same team, he can have 3 players around him and still smash a goal in from anywhere around the box. I am in no way trying to have a go at bobby, but for the moment his contribution is seriously starting to be hurt because he cant operate against teams with a double low block. Maybe a Timo Werner is exactly what we need at the minute, someone who can spin and smash a goal from nothing. As for Salah, good god I have no idea what has happened to him, he is attempting 1.6 dribbles per match and has a succes rate of 56%. In 17/18 he attempted 2.3 dribbles per match with a success rate of 64%. I looked that up after last night because I have noticed more and more he isnt taking people on, he gets the ball into feet and just tries to shield it and ends up losing the ball most of the time and, considering we know how good of a dribbler he is, i think his form is the most frustrating at the minute.
But I will say this, I dont know if I am crazy or not, but ever since Klopp first took over, everytime there is an international, or break of any kind, we always take a few weeks where we are crap. I think 16/17 is the best example of it where we had just beaten Watford 6-1 at Anfield and were soaring in the clouds, top of the league and smashing in goals for fun. Came back after an international, drew with southampton, were very unconvincing against sunderland then lost to Bournemouth and drew with West Ham. And I have noticed this each season with Klopp so maybe there is something deeper.
Am I daring to attack Klopp? Good god no. The man has done more for this club than the last 6 managers combined and I know how sour i sound at the moment, but I am just very concerned as to the sustainability of our current team when they are churning out more bog standard performances than good ones. Personally the most entertaining season I have ever witnessed was 2017/18, with 2013/14 coming a close second. But the amount of absolutely brilliant performances that were coming from all over the pitch was just breathtaking, the only thing costing us that year was just so many individual mistakes. Now it just feels like a chore to watch us play alot of the time. I am not saying I would trade this season for another 17/18, I mean we are about to win the fckn Premier League for the first time in my lifetime, I just am worried that we may be in for another collapse, like 2014/15.
snippet.textOriginal:
Allison - Fine 
Robbo - I dont know what happened to him, but everytime he got the ball he slowed it down and was always looking to pass the ball back into the middle. Really gave me flashes of Rafa style football.
VVD - Fine. Was kind of shaky but not too bad. 
Lovren - Lovren
Trent - Looked tired and unfocused. 
Fabinho - The only one I thought actually had a good game. 
Wijnaldum - Has looked uninterested for a while now, maybe the contract thing is throwing him but he needs some time on the sidelines.
Ox - Tried his best but still needs a good run of games to get back in the zone like he was towards the end of 2017/18.
Mane - Is always trying his best but it just isnt coming off for him at the moment.
Firmino - Bring in Werner. 
Salah - Bring in Sancho.

Sheffield Utd would be the one I go for. That was 2 months ago. Leicester 4-0 and then Everton 5-2 and City 3-1. They would be the only games I can look to and say "Yeah we played really well". Because for me it seems to be every other week. 
But back to the point about freshness. Firmino's last goal at anfield was 10 and a half months ago. I know he is not an out and out goalscorer and brings alot to the team, but has he been recently? Now it just feels like a chore to watch us play alot of the time. snippet.textDisplay: That was pathetic shambles we didn't even turn up . We haven't looked right since winter break . Lovren should not play again for Liverpool he's a joke were more disorganized . Looked like a deer in the headlights . They need to wake up , you can't play cruise control we are Liverpool . Salah was awful and Trent tried but was all over the place were missing hendo and Milly they would not stand for that God awful performance that was absolutely garbage . I can't believe it. We didn't turn up we were just going through the motions we must do better a lot better. Absolutely gutted ox wasn't up to par either no one was . We must not play like we just turn up and automatically win , we must earn it play 100% every game . Maybe fresh the team up a bit but something needs to change . That loss hurt more than losing to city last year . The fact that it was on paper a strong team and we lost hurts even more . We must play with passion and the hunger we had before the winter break .

When Lovren's on the pitch,Liverpool might as we play with 10 men!
snippet.textOriginal:
Lovren is,the worst defender Liverpool have had. His to blame,for almost every game we lose,that he plays in. One goal,doesn't make you a good footballer. Klopp,said he was worth £20 million,for scoring one fucking goal. His not worth the shit on my shoes!
Why,he wasn't sold in,the summer is anyone guess. All I know is this,he shouldn't still,be at Liverpool,to put in another shit performance!
Ruiz,cost Chelsea the title and Lovren,cost Liverpool the title,both players are overrated. They,couldn't defend a goal in the MLS,which is where both of them,will end up!
When Lovren's on the pitch,Liverpool might as we play with 10 men!

snippet.textDisplay: Harsh on Lovren boys. Trent was worse by far. There was no tracking back from the forwards. Last year and year before it was Virg switching play to a full back them running and getting the ball in. Now it's all short passes and blind long balls. Lucky the lead is what it is.

snippet.textDisplay:
Harsh on fabinho he at least tried to put a pass through but when nobody is moving it's shit. Total disconnect from bank to front even Allison almost kicked the ball straight to a Watford player few minutes into the game. TAA cost us a goal and two goals went past VVD side not lovren. Gomez would have got manhandled by deeney just like last time so why didn't VVD take him. 3wks ago I looked at the fixture and the one game that stood out was this one. Why? Cos they had us at Anfield we got lucky the only team who troubled us. The wham & athletic games were not great so this was on the cards Watford knew it. Look at the brightside the 4th win could be at city how sweet. Raheem will have to watch and pep congratulate us.
It will be in front of a capacity empty crowd. But city fans will get to see another trophy lifted.

snippet.textDisplay:
@ Stanley13

Let me tell you what Hendo,who you most disrespectfully refer to as a donkey,does.
He fights more than any other mid player for every lost ball.
He covers for Trent when going forward.
He constantly keeps everyone around him on their toes.
He gets better & better and loves proving haters like you wrong.
He is the ONLY Liverpool captain to bring the CWC to Anfield.
We lost our first PL game this season barely a week after Hendo's absence.
Who's the real donkey?
